description.zh-cn: 指自1911年武昌起义至1949年底中华民国政府迁台之间，中华民国中央政府统治中国大陆的历史时期，是中国历史上首次施行共和立宪制的时期。
description.en: Refers to the historical period from the Wuchang Uprising in 1911 to the relocation of the Republic of China government to Taiwan at the end of 1949, during which the central government of the Republic of China ruled mainland China. It was the first period in Chinese history to implement a republican constitutional system.

description.zh-cn: 亚洲第一个民主共和国，于1912年1月1日在中国大陆成立。1912年至1949年，其治权及主权及于中国大陆。1949年后，因国共内战失利，治权仅限于台湾、澎湖、金门、马祖等地。
description.en: The first democratic republic in Asia, established in mainland China on January 1, 1912. From 1912 to 1949, its jurisdiction and sovereignty extended over mainland China. After 1949, due to the loss in the Chinese Civil War, its jurisdiction is limited to Taiwan, Penghu, Kinmen, and Matsu.

description.zh-cn: 20世纪初中国爆发的一场旨在推翻清朝专制帝制、建立共和政体的全国性革命。
description.en: A nationwide revolution in early 20th-century China aimed at overthrowing the Qing dynasty's autocratic monarchy and establishing a republican form of government.

description.zh-cn: 中国历史上最后一个帝制王朝，由满族建立。于1912年因辛亥革命而覆灭。
description.en: The last imperial dynasty in Chinese history, established by the Manchu people. It was overthrown in 1912 by the Xinhai Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命的伟大先行者，中华民国和中国国民党的缔造者，被尊称为“国父”。
description.en: A great pioneer of China's modern democratic revolution, the founder of the Republic of China and the Kuomintang (KMT), honored as the "Father of the Nation".

nodes.id: 中华民国临时政府 (1912年—1913年)

zh-cn: 中华民国临时政府 (1912年—1913年)

description.zh-cn: 辛亥革命后由革命党人于1912年1月1日在南京成立的临时政府，是中华民国历史上第一个中央政府机构。
description.en: The provisional government established in Nanjing on January 1, 1912, by revolutionaries after the Xinhai Revolution. It was the first central government institution in the history of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 清末民初的军事及政治人物，北洋军阀的创始人，曾任中华民国临时大总统及第一任正式大总统，后称帝建立中华帝国但迅速失败。
description.en: A military and political figure in the late Qing dynasty and early Republic of China, founder of the Beiyang Army. He served as the provisional and first formal president of the Republic of China, later proclaimed himself emperor establishing the Empire of China, which quickly failed.

description.zh-cn: 1913年至1928年间代表中国的合法政府，由北洋军阀掌控，以北京为首都。
description.en: The legitimate government of China from 1913 to 1928, controlled by the Beiyang warlords and based in Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 由中国国民党于1925年在广州成立的政府，在1928年北伐成功后成为代表中国的中央政府，1948年改组为行宪的中华民国政府。
description.en: The government established by the Kuomintang in Guangzhou in 1925. It became the central government of China after the success of the Northern Expedition in 1928 and was reorganized into the constitutional government of the Republic of China in 1948.

description.zh-cn: 由孙中山于1919年改组中华革命党而成，是中华民国的创建政党。在大陆时期长期为执政党。
description.en: Formed by Sun Yat-sen in 1919 by reorganizing the Chinese Revolutionary Party, it is the founding party of the Republic of China and was the long-term ruling party during the mainland period.

description.zh-cn: 由国民政府发动，旨在推翻北洋政府统治、统一中国的战争。
description.en: A military campaign launched by the Nationalist Government aimed at overthrowing the Beiyang government and unifying China.

description.zh-cn: 成立于1921年，在国共内战中获胜后于1949年建立了中华人民共和国。
description.en: Founded in 1921, it established the People's Republic of China in 1949 after winning the Chinese Civil War.

description.zh-cn: 1927年至1937年间，由中国国民党与中国共产党之间爆发的内战，因西安事变与抗日战争爆发而暂时中止。
description.en: The civil war between the Kuomintang and the Communist Party of China from 1927 to 1937, which was temporarily suspended due to the Xi'an Incident and the outbreak of the Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪末至20世纪中叶的日本国号。在1930年代至1940年代对中国发动了全面的侵略战争。
description.en: The name of the state of Japan from the late 19th to the mid-20th century. It launched a full-scale war of aggression against China from the 1930s to the 1940s.

description.zh-cn: 1931年日本在中国东北蓄意制造并发动的一起侵华事件，是日本侵华战争的开端。
description.en: An incident staged by Japan in Northeast China in 1931, which served as a pretext for the Japanese invasion and marked the beginning of the war of aggression against China.

description.zh-cn: 日本在九一八事变后在中国东北地区扶植建立的傀儡政权。
description.en: A puppet state established by Japan in Northeast China after the Mukden Incident.

description.zh-cn: 国民党将领张学良和杨虎城发动的兵谏，迫使蒋中正停止剿共、联共抗日，促成了第二次国共合作。
description.en: A military coup staged by KMT generals Zhang Xueliang and Yang Hucheng, which forced Chiang Kai-shek to cease his anti-communist campaign and cooperate with the communists to resist Japan, leading to the Second United Front.

description.zh-cn: 20世纪30年代至40年代，中华民国抵抗大日本帝国侵略的全面战争，是第二次世界大战的亚洲主战场。
description.en: A full-scale war fought by the Republic of China against the invasion of the Empire of Japan from the 1930s to the 1940s, which was the main theater of World War II in Asia.

description.zh-cn: 日本军队在卢沟桥发动的军事冲突，标志着中国抗日战争的全面爆发。
description.en: A military conflict initiated by Japanese troops at the Marco Polo Bridge, marking the full-scale outbreak of the Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 一场全球性的战争，中国是其亚洲主战场，作为同盟国之一对抗轴心国。
description.en: A global war in which China was a major theater in Asia, fighting as one of the Allied powers against the Axis.

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争结束后，中国国民党与中国共产党之间爆发的全面内战。最终以共产党胜利、国民党政府迁台告终。
description.en: A full-scale civil war between the Kuomintang and the Communist Party of China after the end of the Second Sino-Japanese War. It concluded with the victory of the Communist Party and the retreat of the KMT government to Taiwan.

en: Government of the Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 1947年《中华民国宪法》颁布后，由国民政府改组而成的行宪政府。
description.en: The constitutional government formed by the reorganization of the Nationalist Government after the promulgation of the Constitution of the Republic of China in 1947.

description.zh-cn: 第二次国共内战期间，中国人民解放军与国军之间的三次决定性战役，包括辽沈、淮海、平津三大战役。
description.en: Three decisive campaigns during the Second Chinese Civil War between the People's Liberation Army and the National Revolutionary Army, including the Liaoshen, Huaihai, and Pingjin campaigns.

description.zh-cn: 第二次国共内战末期，中国人民解放军渡过长江，攻占中华民国首都南京的战役。
description.en: A military campaign in the late stage of the Second Chinese Civil War where the People's Liberation Army crossed the Yangtze River and captured Nanjing, the capital of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 由中国共产党于1949年10月1日在北京成立的国家，统治中国大陆至今。
description.en: The state established by the Communist Party of China in Beijing on October 1, 1949, which has ruled mainland China ever since.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治家及军事家，曾任黄埔军校校长、国民革命军总司令、国民政府主席及中华民国总统。
description.en: A politician and military leader of the Republic of China, who served as the commandant of the Whampoa Military Academy, commander-in-chief of the National Revolutionary Army, Chairman of the Nationalist Government, and President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 1949年底，中华民国政府因在第二次国共内战中失利，将中央政府机构迁至台湾台北，开启两岸分治的局面。
description.en: At the end of 1949, due to its defeat in the Second Chinese Civil War, the government of the Republic of China relocated its central government agencies to Taipei, Taiwan, initiating the era of cross-strait division.

description.zh-cn: 1919年爆发的以青年学生为主的爱国运动，起因于巴黎和会对山东问题的不公处理，对中国近现代史影响深远。
description.en: A patriotic movement in 1919, primarily led by young students, sparked by the unfair treatment of the Shandong issue at the Paris Peace Conference. It had a profound impact on modern Chinese history.

description.zh-cn: 第一次世界大战结束后，战胜国为解决战争所造成的问题以及奠定战后的和平而召开的会议。会议中对中国山东权益的处理引发了五四运动。
description.en: A meeting convened by the victorious Allied Powers after World War I to resolve issues caused by the war and establish post-war peace. Its handling of China's rights in Shandong triggered the May Fourth Movement.

description.zh-cn: 20世纪的社会主义国家，在民国时期对中国政治格局有重要影响，如支持孙中山联俄容共、干涉外蒙古独立等。
description.en: A socialist state in the 20th century that had a significant impact on China's political landscape during the Republican era, such as supporting Sun Yat-sen's alliance with the Soviets and the admission of communists, and interfering in Outer Mongolia's independence.

description.zh-cn: 外蒙古在辛亥革命后宣布独立，并在苏联干涉下，最终于1946年获得中华民国政府的正式承认。
description.en: Outer Mongolia declared independence after the Xinhai Revolution and, with Soviet interference, eventually gained formal recognition from the government of the Republic of China in 1946.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代革命家，国民党领袖之一。在1913年即将出任内阁总理时被暗杀，引发二次革命。
description.en: A modern Chinese revolutionary and one of the leaders of the Kuomintang. He was assassinated in 1913 shortly before he was due to become premier, which triggered the Second Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 辛亥革命的爆发导致了清朝的覆灭。
description.en: The outbreak of the Xinhai Revolution led to the overthrow of the Qing dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 辛亥革命成功推翻了帝制，建立了中华民国。
description.en: The Xinhai Revolution successfully overthrew the monarchy and established the Republic of China.

relationships.target: 中华民国临时政府 (1912年—1913年)

description.zh-cn: 孙中山在南京宣誓就任中华民国临时大总统。
description.en: Sun Yat-sen was sworn in as the Provisional President of the Republic of China in Nanjing.

relationships.target: 中华民国临时政府 (1912年—1913年)

description.zh-cn: 在孙中山辞职后，袁世凯在北京就任第二任临时大总统。
description.en: After Sun Yat-sen's resignation, Yuan Shikai assumed office as the second Provisional President in Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 即将出任国务总理的宋教仁被暗杀身亡，普遍认为袁世凯是幕后主使，此事件导致二次革命爆发。
description.en: Song Jiaoren, who was about to become Premier, was assassinated. It is widely believed that Yuan Shikai was behind the plot. This incident triggered the Second Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 国民革命军北伐最终取代了北洋政府，名义上统一了全国。
description.en: The Northern Expedition eventually replaced the Beiyang government, nominally unifying the country.

description.zh-cn: 1925年7月，中国国民党将陆海军大元帅大本营改组为国民政府。
description.en: In July 1925, the Kuomintang reorganized the Generalissimo's Headquarters of the Army and Navy into the Nationalist Government.

description.zh-cn: 巴黎和会上关于山东问题的不公正处理，直接导致了中国国内爆发五四运动。
description.en: The unfair handling of the Shandong issue at the Paris Peace Conference directly led to the outbreak of the May Fourth Movement in China.

description.zh-cn: 蒋中正于1927年4月12日发动清党（四一二事件），捕杀共产党员，导致第一次国共合作破裂。
description.en: Chiang Kai-shek launched a party purge (April 12 Incident) on April 12, 1927, arresting and killing communists, which led to the breakdown of the First United Front.

description.zh-cn: 自1927年清党后，国共两党长期处于敌对状态，爆发了两次大规模内战。
description.en: Since the 1927 party purge, the KMT and the CCP were in a long-term state of hostility, leading to two large-scale civil wars.

description.zh-cn: 1931年九一八事变后，日本在中国东北地区扶持建立了傀儡政权满洲国。
description.en: After the 1931 Mukden Incident, Japan established the puppet state of Manchukuo in Northeast China.

description.zh-cn: 西安事变迫使国民党领导人蒋中正停止内战，与共产党合作共同抗日，促成了第二次国共合作。
description.en: The Xi'an Incident forced KMT leader Chiang Kai-shek to stop the civil war and cooperate with the Communist Party to resist Japan, leading to the Second United Front.

description.zh-cn: 七七事变的发生标志着中国抗日战争的全面爆发。
description.en: The Marco Polo Bridge Incident marked the full-scale outbreak of the Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 在1937年至1945年间，中华民国与大日本帝国进行了全面的抗日战争。
description.en: Between 1937 and 1945, the Republic of China fought a full-scale war of resistance against the Empire of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 第二次国共内战的失败导致中华民国政府失去对中国大陆的控制权，并迁往台湾。
description.en: The defeat in the Second Chinese Civil War caused the government of the Republic of China to lose control of mainland China and retreat to Taiwan.

description.zh-cn: 三大战役的胜利使中国人民解放军取得了对国军的决定性优势，为最终夺取全国政权奠定了基础。
description.en: The victory in the Three Great Campaigns gave the People's Liberation Army a decisive advantage over the National Army, laying the foundation for the final seizure of national power.

description.zh-cn: 在第二次国共内战中取得胜利后，中国共产党于1949年10月1日建立了中华人民共和国。
description.en: After winning the Second Chinese Civil War, the Communist Party of China established the People's Republic of China on October 1, 1949.

description.zh-cn: 第二次国共内战的局势发展直接导致了中华民国政府于1949年底迁往台湾。
description.en: The development of the Second Chinese Civil War directly led to the relocation of the government of the Republic of China to Taiwan at the end of 1949.

description.zh-cn: 苏联的干涉是导致外蒙古最终从中国独立的关键因素之一。
description.en: Soviet interference was one of the key factors that led to Outer Mongolia's eventual independence from China.
